metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4207 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the QXL display device emulation in QEMU. A double fetch of guest controlled values `cursor->header.width` and `cursor->header.height` can lead to the allocation of a small cursor object followed by a subsequent heap-based buffer overflow. A malicious privileged guest user could use this flaw to crash the QEMU process on the host or potentially execute arbitrary code within the context of the QEMU process.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40

qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40

No subscription required
